reviews.review_msg: 280 was OKAY. Wait till you take ENSC225 with him :)

This guy stinks at teaching. He's incredibly boring, and it's obvious to see that he has 0 interest in what he teaches. The previous offering for 280 exposed you to R and a Matlab project. Nothing like that was to be seen this time around. Instead, we had the pleasure of calculating standard deviations for 30 data values for our exams...

Lectures are a copy paste of the textbook. All assignments and exams are pulled from textbook problems. I didn't find the content very engaging during lectures but he tries his best to involve students. Overall just a very average prof, nothing super great or bad to say. The class material is pretty easy if you take the time to do assignments.

Not great, lectures are copy-pasted from the textbook. Lectures are a waste of your time, just read the textbook on your own. Formulas are not always given. The class is annoying but not necessarily hard, but prepare to do most of the learning on your own.

Professor majid is one of the best and most caring profs I have encountered at SFU, coming into classes he would make everyone feel welcomed with new slides for each lecture and always had an upbeat mood cracking jokes... has an odd fascination with fishes. His exams were easy and fair and always had enough material to review with textbook guides.

Major's monotone voice and direct textbook copied slides make his lectures a drag to sit through. Use the textbook instead of lecture slides for future since he is prone to adding spelling errors in anything from a minor word that wouldn't impact understanding to a blatantly false formula every now and then.
